intro: Berchemia zhejiangensis, commonly known as the Zhejiang berchemia, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with pinnate leaves and small, stipitate flowers clustered in racemes. It is often found in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
